Manx: Yn Chosoylaght Eddyr Deiney as Muckyn
English: The Similarity Between Men and Pigs
Diplomatic: Yn Chosolagh Eddyr Dheiney as Muckyn

Manx: Va buitçhoor keayrt dy row as veagh ny muckyn geiyrt er stiagh ayns thie yn vuitçhoor ga nagh vel muckyn feer arryltagh dy gholl yn raad ta shin yeearree ad dy gholl. V’eh red feer yindyssagh cre’n aght va ny cretooryn cha arryltagh dy roie geiyrt er yn dunver oc. Agh tra v’eh fakinit dy row eshyn dy creeney cur lesh poagey beg dy phishyr as poanrey marish, liorishyn va cleaney ny cretooryn er nyn doshiaght, ta’n oyr er ny hoiggal ec keayrt. Fegooish goaill tastey dy row yn baase cha faggys daue, cha row ny muckyn goaill tastey da red erbee agh ny lane duirn va’n buitçhoor ceau er yn raad, as goll dy siragh gys yn vaase. As er yn aght cheddyn ta dooinney meechrauee geiyrt er noid nyn annym sheese trooid cabbyn nuirin er yn oyr dy vel ad aggindagh er sayntyn yn eill as taitnyssagh er sayntyn peccoil ta’n Jowl cur daue ayns lane duirn nish as reesht er yn raad.
English: There was once a butcher and the pigs would be following him into the butcher’s house, although pigs aren’t very willing to go the way we want them to go. It really was a thing of wonder how the creatures were so willing to run, following their murderer. But when it was seen that he was wisely bringing a little bag of peas and beans with him, by means of which the pigs had an inclination to proceed, the reason is understood at once. The pigs weren’t noticing that death was so close to them, the pigs weren’t paying heed to anything else but the handfuls the butcher was throwing on the road, and going hurriedly to death. And in the same way an irreligious man follows the enemy of our souls down through the jaws of hell because they are desirous of the lusts of the flesh and delighting in sinful desires the Devil is giving them in handfuls now and then on the way.
Diplomatic: Va butchoor cheayrt dy row as vagh ny muckyn giyrt er stiagh ayns thie yn vutchooyr gha nagh vell muckyn feer arryltagh dy gholl yn raaid ta shin yeearee ad dy gholl ve red feer yindysagh cren aght va ny cretooryn cha arryltagh dy roie geiyrt er yn dunver ock Agh tra ve fakinyt dy row eshyn dy dy creeney cur lesh poagey beg dy fishyr as ponrey maarish liorish shen va cleaney ny cretooryn er nyn doshagh. Tan oyr er ny hoiggal eck cheayrt fegooish ghoaill tastey dy row yn baase cha faggys daue. cha row ny muckyn goaill tastey da red erbee agh ny lane dhurn van butchoor cheau er yn raaid as gholl dy siragh gys yn vaase. As er yn aght cheddyn ta doinney mee crauee giyrt er noid nyn annym sheesh trooid cabbyn nuirin er yn oyr dy vell ad agindagh er sayntyn yn eill as taitnysagh er sayntyn peccoil lan??? (ta’n) Jowl cur daue ayns lane dhorn nish as reesht er yn raaid.

Manx: Aless dy vel lheid yn chosoylagh eddyr deiney as muckyn.
English: Alas, there is such a similarity between men and pigs.
Diplomatic: Aless dy vell lheid yn chosolagh eddyr dheiney as muckyn.
